If not, see <https://www.gnu.org/licenses/>.*","methods":{"approveProof(uint24,bytes,address,bool,bytes)":{"details":"Note owner can approve a third party address, such as a smart contract, to spend a proof on their behalf. This allows a batch approval of notes to be performed, rather than individually for each note via confidentialApprove().","params":{"_proofId":"- id of proof to be approved. Needs to be a balanced proof.","_proofOutputs":"- data of proof","_proofSignature":"- ECDSA signature over the proof, approving it to be spent","_spender":"- address being approved to spend the notes"}},"confidentialApprove(bytes32,address,bool,bytes)":{"details":"Note owner approving a third party, another address, to spend the note on owner's behalf. This is necessary to allow the confidentialTransferFrom() method to be called","params":{"_noteHash":"- keccak256 hash of the note coordinates (gamma and sigma)","_signature":"- ECDSA signature from the note owner that validates the confidentialApprove() instruction","_spender":"- address being approved to spend the note","_spenderApproval":"- defines whether the _spender address is being approved to spend the note, or if permission is being revoked. True if approved, false if not approved"}},"confidentialBurn(uint24,bytes)":{"details":"Executes a confidential burning procedure, dependent on the provided proofData being succesfully validated by the zero-knowledge validator","params":{"_proof":"- uint24 variable which acts as a unique identifier for the proof which _proofOutput is being submitted. _proof contains three concatenated uint8 variables: 1) epoch number 2) category number 3) ID number for the proof","_proofData":"- bytes array of proof data, outputted from a proof construction"}},"confidentialTransfer(bytes,bytes)":{"details":"Executes a basic unilateral, confidential transfer of AZTEC notes Will submit _proofData to the validateProof() function of the Cryptography Engine.    * Upon successfull verification, it will update note registry state - creating output notes and destroying input notes.","params":{"_proofData":"- bytes variable outputted from a proof verification contract, representing transfer instructions for the IACE","_signatures":"- array of the ECDSA signatures over all inputNotes"}},"confidentialTransfer(uint24,bytes,bytes)":{"details":"Executes a basic unilateral, confidential transfer of AZTEC notes Will submit _proofData to the validateProof() function of the Cryptography Engine.    * Upon successfull verification, it will update note registry state - creating output notes and destroying input notes.","params":{"_proofData":"- bytes variable outputted from a proof verification contract, representing transfer instructions for the ACE","_proofId":"- id of proof to be validated. Needs to be a balanced proof.","_signatures":"- array of the ECDSA signatures over all inputNotes"}},"confidentialTransferFrom(uint24,bytes)":{"details":"Executes a value transfer mediated by smart contracts. The method is supplied with transfer instructions represented by a bytes _proofOutput argument that was outputted from a proof verification contract.","params":{"_proofId":"- uint24 variable which acts as a unique identifier for the proof which _proofOutput is being submitted. _proof contains three concatenated uint8 variables: 1) epoch number 2) category number 3) ID number for the proof","_proofOutput":"- output of a zero-knowledge proof validation contract. Represents transfer instructions for the ACE"}},"isOwner()":{"details":"Returns true if the caller is the current owner."},"owner()":{"details":"Returns the address of the current owner."},"renounceOwnership()":{"details":"Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner.     * NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner."},"setProofs(uint8,uint256)":{"details":"Set which proofs this asset is able to listen to and validate","params":{"_epoch":"epoch number to which the proof belongs","_proofs":"proofs for which the asset will listen to"}},"supportsProof(uint24)":{"details":"Return whether the proof is supported or not by this asset. Note that we have    to subtract 1 from the proof id because the original representation is uint8,    but here that id is considered to be an exponent","params":{"_proof":"- unique identifier specifying the proof to be checked as to whether it is                supported by the asset"},"return":"boolean defining whether the asset supports the proof specified by _proof input"},"transferOwnership(address)":{"details":"Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner."},"updateNoteMetaData(bytes32,bytes)":{"details":"Update the metadata of a note that already exists in storage.","params":{"metaData":"- metadata to update the note with","noteHash":"- hash of a note, used as a unique identifier for the note"}},"upgradeRegistryVersion(uint24)":{"details":"Upgrade the note registry of this asset, by pointing it to a new factory","params":{"_factoryId":"- the ID of the factory which will supply the upgraded behaviour confidentialBurn

attributes.type: function (bytes memory) pure returns (bytes memory,bytes memory,address,int256)
function (bytes memory) pure returns (bytes memory,bytes memory,address,int256)

devdoc.author: AZTEC
devdoc.details: A contract defining the standard interface and behaviours of a confidential burnable asset. * Copyright 2020 Spilsbury Holdings Ltd  * Licensed under the GNU Lesser General Public Licence, Version 3.0 (the "License"); you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. * This program is distributed in the hope that it will be useful, but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.  See the GNU Lesser General Public License for more details. * You should have received a copy of the GNU Lesser General Public License along with this program.  If not, see <https://www.gnu.org/licenses/>.*

approveProof(uint24,bytes,address,bool,b.details: Note owner can approve a third party address, such as a smart contract, to spend a proof on their behalf. This allows a batch approval of notes to be performed, rather than individually for each note via confidentialApprove().

params._proofId: - id of proof to be approved. Needs to be a balanced proof.
params._proofSignature: - ECDSA signature over the proof, approving it to be spent
params._spender: - address being approved to spend the notes

confidentialApprove(bytes32,address,bool.details: Note owner approving a third party, another address, to spend the note on owner's behalf. This is necessary to allow the confidentialTransferFrom() method to be called

params._noteHash: - keccak256 hash of the note coordinates (gamma and sigma)
params._signature: - ECDSA signature from the note owner that validates the confidentialApprove() instruction
params._spender: - address being approved to spend the note
params._spenderApproval: - defines whether the _spender address is being approved to spend the note, or if permission is being revoked. True if approved, false if not approved

confidentialBurn(uint24,bytes).details: Executes a confidential burning procedure, dependent on the provided proofData being succesfully validated by the zero-knowledge validator

params._proof: - uint24 variable which acts as a unique identifier for the proof which _proofOutput is being submitted. _proof contains three concatenated uint8 variables: 1) epoch number 2) category number 3) ID number for the proof
params._proofData: - bytes array of proof data, outputted from a proof construction

confidentialTransfer(bytes,bytes).details: Executes a basic unilateral, confidential transfer of AZTEC notes Will submit _proofData to the validateProof() function of the Cryptography Engine.    * Upon successfull verification, it will update note registry state - creating output notes and destroying input notes.

params._proofData: - bytes variable outputted from a proof verification contract, representing transfer instructions for the IACE
params._signatures: - array of the ECDSA signatures over all inputNotes

confidentialTransfer(uint24,bytes,bytes).details: Executes a basic unilateral, confidential transfer of AZTEC notes Will submit _proofData to the validateProof() function of the Cryptography Engine.    * Upon successfull verification, it will update note registry state - creating output notes and destroying input notes.

params._proofData: - bytes variable outputted from a proof verification contract, representing transfer instructions for the ACE
params._proofId: - id of proof to be validated. Needs to be a balanced proof.
params._signatures: - array of the ECDSA signatures over all inputNotes

confidentialTransferFrom(uint24,bytes).details: Executes a value transfer mediated by smart contracts. The method is supplied with transfer instructions represented by a bytes _proofOutput argument that was outputted from a proof verification contract.

params._proofId: - uint24 variable which acts as a unique identifier for the proof which _proofOutput is being submitted. _proof contains three concatenated uint8 variables: 1) epoch number 2) category number 3) ID number for the proof
params._proofOutput: - output of a zero-knowledge proof validation contract. Represents transfer instructions for the ACE

isOwner().details: Returns true if the caller is the current owner.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner.     * NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

setProofs(uint8,uint256).details: Set which proofs this asset is able to listen to and validate

params._epoch: epoch number to which the proof belongs
params._proofs: proofs for which the asset will listen to

supportsProof(uint24).details: Return whether the proof is supported or not by this asset. Note that we have    to subtract 1 from the proof id because the original representation is uint8,    but here that id is considered to be an exponent

params._proof: - unique identifier specifying the proof to be checked as to whether it is                supported by the asset

supportsProof(uint24).return: boolean defining whether the asset supports the proof specified by _proof input

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

updateNoteMetaData(bytes32,bytes).details: Update the metadata of a note that already exists in storage.

params.metaData: - metadata to update the note with
params.noteHash: - hash of a note, used as a unique identifier for the note

upgradeRegistryVersion(uint24).details: Upgrade the note registry of this asset, by pointing it to a new factory

params._factoryId: - the ID of the factory which will supply the upgraded behaviour contracts
